licence_overview:
You need a close protection licence if you work as a bodyguard, or guard one or more individuals from the threat of assault or other injuries that might be inflicted by others. You must also have a licence if your services are supplied for, or in connection with, a contract with a consumer.

Licences are issued by the [Security Industry Authority (SIA).](http://www.sia.homeoffice.gov.uk/Pages/home.aspx "Security Industry Authority"){:rel="external"}

There are two types of licence:  

- a front line licence for bodyguards
- a non-front line licence for managers, supervisors and other staff who don't carry out front line duties

##Conditions
In order to obtain your licence you must be at least 18 years of age, and you must pass an identity check and a [criminal record check.](/crb-criminal-records-bureau-check/getting-a-criminal-record-check "Criminal record check") For front line roles you must also hold the appropriate SIA-approved qualification.

##How to apply
You can [complete your SIA licence application](http://www.sia.homeoffice.gov.uk/Pages/licensing-applying.aspx "Complete your SIA licence application")  online or through the post.You must supply the supporting relevant documentation and pay a fee.

The licence application costs £245 and is non-refundable. Licences last for three years. If you pay your own licence fee, you can claim tax relief. If you are an employer paying an employee's licence fee, there will be no tax or National Insurance (NI) liability. If you need more than one licence, you may be eligible for a 50 per cent discount for the second application fee.

You must renew your licence before it expires to continue working. You can apply to renew your licence up to four months before the expiry of your current licence.

The SIA can visit your place of business or place of work (where your licensed action is undertaken) to assess your compliance with any ongoing obligations. You may also have to provide any relevant documents or information to show your compliance with any licence obligations.

*[SIA]:Security Industry Authority
*[NI]:National Insurance
